document.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a piece of paper that has official information on it
document.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a piece of written work that is stored on a computer
document.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to write about something, film it, or take photographs of it, in order to record information about it
document.translation[1].definitions[0].e: His research documents how the crisis occurred.
document.translation[1].definitions[1].d: to support an opinion, argument etc with recorded facts
document.translation[1].definitions[1].e: It is well documented that men die younger than women.
document.translation[2].definitions[0].d: a record of important information on paper or computer disk
document.translation[2].definitions[0].e: His main expense is photocopying thousands of legal documents.
document.translation[3].definitions[0].d: to record important information on paper, film, or computer disk
document.translation[3].definitions[0].e: The New York agency documented 60 attacks on journalists.
